intro: Pavetta phanerophlebia, commonly known as the showy pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruits are typically capsules that release seeds when mature. Pavetta phanerophlebia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
